website_summaries.verdict: A complete spray-on kit that won't leave you needing any extra paint or equipment.
pros: The kit comes with everything you need to quickly and efficiently spray on one or two layers of a protective liner
Resulting finish is thick and durable for extreme use in the truck bed
cons: Spray-on bed liner kit can over- spray onto other areas of the truck if not careful

customer_reviews.title: The liner bubbled and cracked in some places.
customer_reviews.text: Preparation was meticulous before aplication and all instructions were followed. After it hardened it looks like shrinkage developed in some spots that led to bubbles which peeled off, particularly on curved surfaces meeting the bottom of the bed. Tried to contact raptor directly about the issue with no luck.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: High-end professional stuff!! Worked great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a full size F150. Well I tried the bed liner spray from Walmart the first time. There’s a reason it was $8 a can.... Anyway, I received the Raptor kit. Then I prepped my truck bed by sanding it down with an hand held electric mouse sander. I used my air compressor and mixed the first bottle. Right before I finished the first bottle, I mixed the second bottle. Anyway, long story short, I was super impressed!! It covered my bed, sides, and tailgate with only two bottles!! I still have two bottles and half of the hardener left over. Great product. Just make sure you have a 5 gallon or higher compressor or it with take forever.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: As bedliner it seems to get scratched easily. Sliding a tool box across the bed damaged ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this as both bedliner and undercoating. As bedliner it seems to get scratched easily. Sliding a tool box across the bed damaged it all the way to the metal of the bed. After repair I slid two leaf springs from a Yukon into the bed and it resulted in new scratches in different locations. Yes - the surface was sanded and prepped before each application (the first application was done by a pro). As for undercoating, only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Nofufb

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, but flakes and scratches.
customer_reviews.text: So if you’re using this for a “looks” product, then by all means. Buy it. Aside from that, this product is useless. I’ll start with the quantity. The 4 bottles is NOT enough for a 2016 silverado standard bed. You would need 6-8 to get a good coating like it should have. I’ve had this product for several months now, and I’ve just accepted the fact that if I ever have to have something heavy and hard in the bed, the bed liner is coming off with it. Pretty awful stuff. The aproperate prepperations were taken before being painted. The bed was completely sanded and mineral spirits were used to clean it. Just a bad product.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Kasper

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good, But Doesn't Hold Up Very Well
customer_reviews.text: This stuff looks really great once it is spayed on. I followed the instructions as shown in the company literature and YouTube. Unfortunately, the liner is not as strong as a commercial grade liner. The liner failed where I was pulling a lawn chair across it. It exposed the metal underneath. I had some left-over supply, so I it on the truck's brush-guard and will be updating this review after a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong Stuff - Preparation us Key
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this product. Clean the surface with wax and grease remover scuff it and clean again. Then apply at about 50 psi, clean gun, flash off for an hour, put on another coat. I did the entire Bronco exterior with 9 bottles.
customer_reviews.author: John K

customer_reviews.title: Very user friendly!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product, much harder than Linex which feels more rubbery. Raptor is easier to clean which is why i went that direction to spray the rocker panel on my truck. The previous owner didnt run mudflaps or steps which led to alot of rock chips down the rocker. I sanded them down and sprayed some Primer and shot the Raptor over it and it looks great and even more protected now!
customer_reviews.author: Devyn

customer_reviews.title: Easy enough for anyone to use with great results
customer_reviews.text: This is quite easy to use. I like that it's not as chunky or glossy as "Hercules". Expect a loud scent, even if you're spraying outdoors. No way would I spray this in a garage or shed. My job was small so I didn't use a mask , but if you need to use all 4 bottles I would recommend a respirator. Can't comment on the durability but looks really nice. I would like to see an alternative offered in an alternative 'flat' option. If you're concerned about over-spray, don't mind a glossier finish & don't mind stirring a lot, the Hercules product is very good as well. Just a matter of preference.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, easy to apply appears to be tough
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Very hard when dries. Easy to apply and fast. Looks good. I wanted something to put on the bed of my truck so things wouldn’t slide around so much, this didn’t do that, but it looks really good and it appears to be tough. I ended up putting Herculiner on top and that worked better for what I want. I’m thinking about using what I have left over of the Upol as a liner on the bottom of my truck for reduction of rock dents. It will look good!
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Looks great and protects whatever you are ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Looks great and protects whatever you are putting it on. I did my truck on the sides where lots of rocks fly up and it doesn't chip or flake off at all. Easy to spray on just the prep time that's all that takes time.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bates

customer_reviews.title: Raptor liner in a jeep tj
customer_reviews.text: Could not be happier with the results from this bed liner. Prep is everything so take the time and do it right you will be glad you did. I used this kit and along with u-pols acid etch primer where bare metal was exposed in the tub of my 97 tj and it turned out amazing. I was on the fence so is you are reading this and are in a similar position...go for it!!
customer_reviews.author: Farmerjo

customer_reviews.title: Short bed - buy at least two more bottles...
customer_reviews.text: Easy application process. The gun that came with the kit worked well. Looks good. I removed the tape after 45 minutes. The 4 bottles of product was barely enough to do one coat on my Nissan Frontier bed. I wish I had bought at least two more bottles. I used the leftover product from the mostly empty bottles and an old toothbrush to touch up a few small spots.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Rupert

customer_reviews.title: Used on Jeep Wrangler
customer_reviews.text: I removed the old carpet in my 91 Jeep Wrangler and installed Raptor Liner. Prior to applying the Raptor liner, i sanded the interior to rough up the existing paint, sprayed Grip 4 on all bare metal, and applied 2 coats of raptor liner to the sidewalls of the tub and 3 to the floor pans. That was over 1 year ago and the Raptor Liner still looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Winter

customer_reviews.title: Good bedliner, not great..
customer_reviews.text: Good spray on truck bed liner. EASY to mix and spray with everything included. Only con is that if its not thick enough it chips easily. Too thick and it will peel back if the substrate is not properly prepped for adhesion. Follow the directions to the letter and you will be more than pleased with the outcome. Easy to re-apply if necessary also.
customer_reviews.author: FathomX

customer_reviews.title: Preparation is key!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is awesome! I've tried Duplicolor Bed Armor, Regular Duplicolor Bedliner, Rust-Oleum Bed Liner, Rust-Oleum Professional Bedliner, and Herculiner, and none of those even compare to Raptor Liner. Dries very hard, seems to clean off easy, and looks great! I sprayed the bottom part of my Jeep, and new offroad front and rear bumpers with two solid coats and only used 2 liters.
customer_reviews.author: That Detail Guy MI

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Application was a breeze. I used this so spray a van floor and this kit coated an 8 foot long section with great coverage. I added anti slip for the final coat and sprinkled paint chips on top to give it a different look.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Sprays on easy and looks professional
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to use and looks professional. I only used a 6 gallon compressor, which is well below what should be used, and I got great results. I used all 4 bottles to spray my short bed truck. If spraying a longer truck, I would get a few extra bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: this stuff worked great and was fairly easy to apply
customer_reviews.text: this stuff worked great and was fairly easy to apply. the prep and taping was the hardest part. We lined the inside of my son's Jeep Wangler and the outcome was nice. I would recommend this if you are familiar with the spray painting process. Be careful not to get this stuff on anything you don't want covered especially your hands it won't come off, and don't shake the bottle once you have it attached to the gun it will come out the vent hole in the top.
customer_reviews.author: Dabo

customer_reviews.title: Buy extra!! Was told by their text it should be as thick as a penny
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my 4th gen ram 1500 6.4 foot bed. I thought the kit would be 1 kit for 1 avg size bed. Sadly this is not the case. There was not enough to apply a good enough coat over the entire bed and I now am left with thin spots that show red through. Word for wisdom buy more then you think you need. Now after calling U-Pol I need to rescuff the entire bed with red scotchbrite apply a full coat of adhesion promoter over the entire thing and respray to fill in the gaps after I wait a week for it to dry
customer_reviews.author: Nlhilf

customer_reviews.title: Nice stuff
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the results! Can't speak about durability since I have yet to test it but looks good. Prep took me around 3 hours since I made sure everything was sanded pretty good. Used 120 grit sand paper since that's only one I had for sander. Used the etch primer and adhesion promoter as well. Spraying was pretty easy. The 4 bottle kit allowed me to spray the sides once and floor/tailgate twice.
customer_reviews.author: J.V

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is tough.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is the real deal, it will take about a month to fully harden. I would give it a couple days to harden before putting it through anything semi rough. I did my bed and get compliments on a daily basis. I bought more to do my bumpers and skirts on my ram. They were gonna charge me $2,500 to do my bed, I did it for$ 300
customer_reviews.author: Daniel gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: It was very easy to apply and made a huge difference in the ...
customer_reviews.text: This product really surprised me. It was very easy to apply and made a huge difference in the appearance of my Jeep. I cannot rate this product for heavy duty applications, but for light use it is great. I have had it applied for 7 months now and is holding up well. I do not throw metal objects on it or anything. I would use this again in light use applications.
customer_reviews.author: michael montoya

customer_reviews.title: it is truly the best. So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: My second time purchasing and using this product. This time on my 08 Silverado. Can't say enough about this product, it is truly the best. So easy to use, simple to follow instructions. Amazing quality. But it all comes down to the prep work. You gotta do that correctly. The finished product is something you will appreciate for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: LvnInOC

customer_reviews.title: Poor Durability
customer_reviews.text: I applied bed liner last year in early June. I followed manufacturers directions using etch,adhesion and epoxy bedliner and liner is already starting to break down. The bed of my truck does not get extensive use, only the usual, trips to the big box stores and transporting items for camping trips. Chris Kane
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff and a great price. Super easy to use. I had more than enough for two thick coatings on my 6.5ft bed and tailgate. (02 Silverado extended cab). I sprayed at 60psi which made finer granules. I would definitely buy again. Also I would definitely buy a respirator.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good bedliner
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Bedliner, still have 3 cans left. Has a glossy black texture and doesn’t look chalky like some brands. Easy to use and apply. They also make a tintable version you can tint with your own basecoat color
customer_reviews.author: James Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Great Undercoating!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, My husband used it on the trunk, fender wells and gas tank of a 1967 Mustang. Several important notes: Use a good respirator or use this product outdoors! You might want to wear a cheap painter's coverall or old clothes as well. Make sure you clean the gun immediately after use, it will harden in there just like on your vehicle! Xylol (Xylene) works great for cleanup, again use a respirator or outdoors! Make sure you mask everything well beyond where you are working and ensure you pay attention to where you are aiming the gun! It is easy to spatter tiny dots that you won't notice until you are done!
customer_reviews.author: Mary B.

customer_reviews.title: Superior product
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal product. Used this on my 93 Grand Cherokee. The plastic cladding on the doors and rockers are notorious for trapping moisture, road debris, salt, etc. Removed all of that from my Jeep, used them as a reference for a body line and sprayed the entire bottom half of my Jeep with it, floor boards and all. 1 year later it's still holding up great and always looks like I just sprayed it everytime I wash it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Not made for a truck that will be used.
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice but it chipped the first time I put my sprayer in the bed and I was gentle. I waited 8 days before I started using it. Looks great but does not appear to be manufactured to last.***July of 2017*** the sprayer is pretty much the only thing that has given me issues. Everything else it has stood up to. So unless you want to pony up for Linex, this is pretty nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob R. Reitz

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend this to anyone who needs to protect a surface
customer_reviews.text: I used this to protect the metal dump bed in a new viking SxS. The metal bed comes with a black paint job so this would soon rust any time it gets scratched. I used this spray and am very impressed with the results. I would highly recommend this to anyone who needs to protect a surface. Easy to apply, looks great, and will provide a barrier to the elements.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: Used this to coat my 12' trailer 2 years ago. And it looks like it was done this spring. There are a few wear through areas on the front rail but I expected that as I trailer commercial lawnmowers 5 days a week and use the front rail to strap the mower down. Excellent product and fairly easy to use. I never did anything like this before and the directions were easy to follow and informative. And spraying was actually enjoyable, smelly but enjoyable. I sprayed outdoors. Overall great product would use again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Quick direction read and easy to setup. Applying was simple and evenly sprayed. Process took about half hour for the first coat, let dry for about an hour and a half between coats. I applied two thick coats and still had some leftover. The spray gun can also be reused so my next order will just be for the product. (I used this product on an '02 GMC Canyon truck bed and it turned out really good.)
customer_reviews.author: SFOLEY

customer_reviews.title: This product is excellent!! It's really tough and has excellent adhesion ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is excellent!! It's really tough and has excellent adhesion anyone saying different does not know how to prep a paint job and probably has a lot of oil and or contamination in there part there trying to coat.. I had some over spray get on some other painted products I didn't care about that were a glossy finish and I couldn't even peel this stuff off and was hard to sand off let alone not adhere. I'm a professional custom auto painter and give this product thumbs up the only thing a little tricky is to match the texture especially if your not spraying all parts at one time
customer_reviews.author: adam madrigal

customer_reviews.title: The bed liner was great but the gun was a disaster it blew up ...
customer_reviews.text: The bed liner was great but the gun was a disaster it blew up in my face and caused eye damage! Brush it on or were a mask to prevent this type of accident.
customer_reviews.author: shuroa

customer_reviews.title: great stuff
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this stuff numerous times, it's great! I covered and entire bivouac trailer
customer_reviews.author: D. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: works excellent.. the more you sand and prep the ...
customer_reviews.text: works excellent.. the more you sand and prep the better you will like it! Keep a check on the temperature outside and humidity along with the moisture of your air compressor too. It will look great!
customer_reviews.author: scoutlaw

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: It's been about 3 weeks and so far I've already been amazed by this stuff. I did my rockers and bottom half of my truck and 3 days after found myself going down 8 miles of a newly stoned chipped road. Still 0 stone chips to this day. Application was surprisingly easy. Expect lots of prep time since your spraying. Took about 22 hours but I go to bare metal, apply rust neutralizer, primer, then the bed liner. I only used two coats and it recommends three.
customer_reviews.author: Jake minnis

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: i bought this along with an extra kit without the gun to paint my 96 k2500 suburban. it took 1 and 1/2 kits to do the complete truck including the cargo rack on the top. the truck looks amazing and this is VERY VERY VERY easy to apply. i spent 16 hours rough sanding the truck and prepping the paint and was surprised that i painted the entire vehicle with 2 coats in less than an hour. i can't recommend this product enough. this was the first vehicle i have painted and it turned out fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: M Harrell

customer_reviews.title: Bedliner liquid gold
customer_reviews.text: I used this product on my tractor and on weathered parts on my truck. For the short ammount of time I have put it to the test and its tough. It comes with the gun and 4 bottles. I bought two kits and used it with my 30hp compressor. It goes on easy at 65 psi, so get you some of that big daddy.
customer_reviews.author: Tate327

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product is the best DIY product on the market. It lays down very easily and lasts very well. I have had it on my jeep tub for 4 years and it has held up very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: John Fischer

customer_reviews.title: I love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: it is all about the prep. it will take you along time to prep everything correctly. this stuff is great you can get the exact texture you want by adjusting how far you hold the gun from the surface or by changing your air pressure. I have put a beating on this stuff and it still looks great. I used it in the tub of a jeep wrangler
customer_reviews.author: Baker Family

customer_reviews.title: Not to happy after all the hard work
customer_reviews.text: It looks really good on my 2014 tundra, however, i follow all recomdations for installation, i was very happy with the end product until after a week later i notice it can get chipped away very easy. Im note sure if i did something wring, but You can chip the product with my finger nails. Not happy after so much hard work. Its brittle and will chip with anything.
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Havent had it on long but so far it seems great. Easy to use looks awesome. Great value
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable coating, easy peezy
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff. Used at 50 psi, threaded the nozzle half way in. Shoot at 12" or more distance. Painted rocker panels and some other worn our plastic parts. Very heavy smell so you must wear a respirator. Dried to the touch in an hour and fully cured after 5 days.
customer_reviews.author: Family

customer_reviews.title: Everything youtube has shown good about this is true
customer_reviews.text: Everything youtube has shown good about this is true. I cant spray paint a sign but with this stuff if i could ld upload a pic of my s10. Recommend buying at least two boxes for complete coverage. Im buying me another after this review to apply more coats and touch ups on edges.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Best DIY spray-on Liner
customer_reviews.text: Ha, I laugh at how easy this spray-on bed liner worked. Why pay $425 for a Rhino Lining, DIY and save hundreds. No over-spray, easy to apply, ensure you get the air gun to apply. minimal tape job needed, mask off your lines, this product keeps a straight line via the tape line.
customer_reviews.author: Rikki-Tikki

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely loved it, was able to spray my truck bed ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loved it, was able to spray my truck bed and bumper. Great product preparation of whatever you are spraying is key and time consuming but the better you do in the prep department the better your final product. The only thing is you need to have an air compressor that will keep up with the spraying (keeping the air pressure constant at 100psi is ideal).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy and tough.
customer_reviews.text: Covers good. Easy to shoot. Order more than you think you need. Put on more coats and be done with it.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Furmanek

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to apply! 40 psi and go!
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff! Easy to mix. Applies well right through the gun! One liter did my bumper perfectly. Now the front bumper and sliders!
customer_reviews.author: JBH

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product that does what it says. I saw the reviews and based off the great reviews I made the purchase. One thing I missed was the gun needs to hook up to a compressor which is fine I just had to purchase a part from home depot. I sprayed my 2017 Chevy Colorado Crew Cab bed and had plenty. 2 coats. Be sure product is thin enough or it starts spitting. Very fast and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Jalo

customer_reviews.title: Worked AWESOME!!
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough about this product. Worked AWESOME!!!! Everyone loves it and thinks it's a profession job. I did do a lot of prep, but it was well worth the results It goes a little farther than I expected. Although, once it's mixed it must be used.
customer_reviews.author: R Porter

customer_reviews.title: ... only been a few days from applying but looks great, feels durable
customer_reviews.text: It's only been a few days from applying but looks great, feels durable. For anybody that is concerned I sprayed this at 65psi with maybe 5.6-6.0 cfm using a 30gal oil less compressor from a box store and it turned out perfect. No need for some huge shop compressor. Definitely will buy again when I spray my brother-in-law jeep floor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is awesome. I sprayed inside and out on my jeep ...
customer_reviews.text: Stay back when you spray in product to get a gritty look. If you get to close it gets slick and hard to get back gritty. This stuff is awesome. I sprayed inside and out on my jeep YJ. Looks awesome. It's nice and thick. My advice is not to go cheap and get just enough. Go head and get that extra bottle or kit to make last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really impressive product
customer_reviews.text: Really worked out well. The final project looked as good as if I had it done professionally. A lot more reasonable doing it myself. I prepped the bed good before application and added the truck guard cap. I do have mechanic experience in the past and maybe that helped.
customer_reviews.author: LilLouLou

customer_reviews.title: Did pretty well, but the coverage wasn't what I quite ...
customer_reviews.text: Did pretty well, but the coverage wasn't what I quite wanted so it took several, several coats. The application was on wood. I will be switching to an epoxy based item in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Garin Hatch

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly simple and awesome, I am now looking around for other projects just to refinish with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Molby

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but...
customer_reviews.text: It's been a year since I sprayed the tub of my tj jeep and there's been some cracking and peeling. I spent a good amount of time prepping before I sprayed. Overall, the product has served its purpose. I've had to go back and peel the loose areas and re-spray them. If I had a chance to do it again I'd probably go with a roll on product.
customer_reviews.author: David D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. If you have an air compressor, you can do it. I purchased this kit and sprayed it on a shortbed Dodge Ram 2500. Went smooth. I have a bottle left over for touch up too.
customer_reviews.author: Larry J. Vanderpool

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: like it all, used two packs for truck restoration, looks good, easy install, etc. great
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I liked this bed liner better than any other I've seen or uzed!! Will recommend this product to otherz!
customer_reviews.author: Todd Hebb

customer_reviews.title: Very good!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, looking good and feels like very hard protectant.
customer_reviews.author: robbyvenetian

customer_reviews.title: Will buy this product again
customer_reviews.text: I used the black to paint the lower section of my van including the bumpers
customer_reviews.author: carla

customer_reviews.title: Great product and easy to apply
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product on my truck for several months and its been heavily used with regular hauls of scrap metal and furniture and it the only place its come off at all is corner of the tail gate from sliding a hand-truck in and out. It's tough stuff and if you are thorough with the prep it will treat you right. It really is a good deal. If you're skeptical about how to apply it watch the video on youtube. Although I just used sand paper and laquer thinner for the prep, it still adhered great and it still looking good. Also very resistant to oil spills. Cleans right off.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Boggs

customer_reviews.title: Was very easy to spray on
customer_reviews.text: Was very easy to spray on. The provided gun works really well. Sprayed at 40psi and the texture is fantastic. 1 kit did 2.5 coats on my interior suv.
customer_reviews.author: Not Me

customer_reviews.title: EASY, EASY
customer_reviews.text: EASY, EASY, EASY!!! Made some planters out of horse troughs for the wife. Wanted to use something that could handle the Texas heat and weather and prevent rusting. Worked perfect. The low flow air gun is NOT reusable but, because its so cheap why would you need to keep it. Would recommended wearing gloves (rubber) to apply if purchased. Not like paint. Once its on, ITS ON!! This save me about $400 bucks!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use with the proper compressor, very durable so far!!
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: This is black as stated.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well after sanding, removing parts I didnt want to tape and taping. Do clean the nozzle after every bottle if you dont want chunks on your new liner. Used on outside of bed of truck. 3 bottles did 2 layers on the outside.
customer_reviews.author: ofblong

customer_reviews.title: Great product easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Had to get a new tailgate on my F150 so had to match the rest of the bed. Matched great! Great product and very easy to use. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan T

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I just recently rebuilt a salvaged Honda Element. They have large plastic moldings on both fenders and both quarter panels. They were originally painted body color, but they were highly damaged. I even had to glue one of them back together because it was literally in two pieces. I used this product as a topcoat for all of them. Wow, it looks amazing. Some elements came with black textured moldings in place of the painted ones. This stuff kind of makes mine look like that with a more rugged appearance once you get up close. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron F.

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with this product
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this product. There was alot more over spray the I first thought there would of been so be more prepared for that than I was - 2hp/20gallon kobalt air compressor sprayed at 60psi
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Pomeroy

customer_reviews.title: but after ample prepping of the bed this product applied easily and looks great
customer_reviews.text: I just applied in the past hour so I can't verify the long term quality, but after ample prepping of the bed this product applied easily and looks great. For a backyard project I'm very impressed. This went on a 95 Taco and I used 3 liters on the bed and tailgate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, I spray it alot , but lately the price has gone up and the amount in the can is decreasing ,yes less and less in the can .
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product!! It covers beautifully and is tough. Easy to use. Looks great on my grill, bumper, and flat bed.
customer_reviews.author: Emerald Layton

customer_reviews.title: Easy and looks great
customer_reviews.text: I used this on the inside body and floor of my 1987 Jeep Wrangler, I love the look. As recommended by other reviews, I ordered the kit because the sprayer was included. You do need an air compressor for this project. Have to say it was so easy "A Girl" did it. You do need an air compressor for this project. I would defininely recommend this project.
customer_reviews.author: Anita F.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to spray
customer_reviews.text: Shipped fast, Easy to spray, Looks great!!! Just make sure you do a good job prepping the surface you are going to spray, it took me 4 hours of prep work and masking and about 30 minutes to spray the inside of my Jeep TJ.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Rush

customer_reviews.title: Bed Liner
customer_reviews.text: Works and looks great. the only problem i had was not see how to put the gun together correctly. I forgot to put the pickup tube in which did not show in the instructions that i saw. Once I figured that out it worked flawlessly. I painted my jeep hard top shell. This kit came with everything needed and worked excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. Sprays easy and is really straight forward. Sticks great if you prep the surface properly.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Dee

customer_reviews.title: Truck bed looks like it was done by a professional
customer_reviews.text: Truck bed looks like it was done by a professional. Only took a few hours to do the whole thing start to finish. We cheated and used an electric sander. Easy clean up of gun- just run a little acetone through the gun after you are finished.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great if instructions are followed.
customer_reviews.text: Buy the spray on adhesion to go along with it.
customer_reviews.author: TooManyToys

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be holding well
customer_reviews.text: I used two of the 4 bottles that came in the kit for a 5.5 ft shortbed. Had I done a more even job, this would be plenty. However I didn't and I'll use a 3rd when I have the free time. Seems durable so far. Caution, Mask off WAY more than you think you need to. I can't see it, but I've got little specs all over my truck now. My fault, but it still sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Batson

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Did the inside of a Jeep YJ tub, had one quart left over. Definitely would use again.
customer_reviews.author: James Horne

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product!!
customer_reviews.text: Took me 1 hour to do my truck bed. No, I did not do ANY prep (accept tape) but its an old truck so I don't care too much. SUPER easy product to use (however it didn't come with instructions, bur their website has videos) and I am going to buy another box of it for the bottom half of my truck body.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Gayle

customer_reviews.title: Globbed
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem with a glob of product coming out of the nozzle and ruining my finish. I would like to contact the seller to discus
customer_reviews.author: steven duke

customer_reviews.title: Incredible product
customer_reviews.text: Incredible finished product! I didn't have much prep work to do as I started with a primered surface, but the finish is awesome with this stuff. Very easy to spray and looks awesome when it cures. Urethane product, so you can simply re-apply additional coats/repairs with minimal prep later on. I would recommend this to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: Used this on two projects. On interior of my ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this on two projects. On interior of my old jeep. 2 years later, no fades, no chips. Used Acid #8 on bare metal for primer. 2nd project was for coating my fiberglass swim platform of a ski boat . Grippy even when wet, hasn't faded in the brutal sun.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Steal of a deal!
customer_reviews.text: Put this on my roof while I was home for Thanksgiving. Applied it when it was about 40ish degrees outside. Well below the recommend temp. Then drive 400 miles in a snow storm 2 days later. It's been 5 months now and it's still looking great!
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is way better than the rattle can or roll on bedliner
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is way better than the rattle can or roll on bedliner. It dries a lot harder and keeps its color in the sun a lot longer. Very easy to shoot as well.
customer_reviews.author: trax85

customer_reviews.title: Quality seems to be superb so far. The spray ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality seems to be superb so far. The spray gun works flawlessly. I used this stuff to paint my grill and fender flares. Anxious to see how it holds up during Michigan winters.
customer_reviews.author: Cody H.

customer_reviews.title: Why pay 600-700 bucks when you can easily do it yourself for under 150??
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this after reading all the positive reviews and they are right...Outstanding product! One four bottle kit provided a very solid and uniform coat to my 2007 Ford F150 6.5 foot bed. Why pay 600-700 bucks when you can do it yourself for under 150? Highly recommend this. Easy peasy for do it yourselfers.
customer_reviews.author: Fireman Chris

customer_reviews.title: Might not be good for heavy duty usage
customer_reviews.text: Decent product. Goes on hard compared to other bed liners so it has a tendency to chip off in chunks from use. Still gives a nice clean look when applied correctly but I would not recommend it for a heavy or hard used truck bed.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for! Spend the time ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for! Spend the time on the prep and it's bullet proof... well worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Allan B.

customer_reviews.title: Yes!!
customer_reviews.text: I just did this last week on my truck. I looks real good! I scuffed up the bed really good, every nook n cranny. then cleaned with degrease, then sprayed self etching primer. then sprayed the Raptor liner! Looks real good. I want to Raptor line everything on my truck now.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Sprayed easy! By far the best DIY bedliner kit i've ...
customer_reviews.text: Sprayed easy! By far the best DIY bedliner kit i've used in the body shop. You can shake and spray from the bottle. You can also reduce it a little too.
customer_reviews.author: dealjunkii

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. Have been using for a year now on insides of jeeps.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Bradfield

customer_reviews.title: pissed me off that I spent a great deal of money on an item and THEY DID ...
customer_reviews.text: don't buy this product from this seller. Mine came and it was open I the box leaked all over hell to the point on not being able to use it. this seller DID NOTHING FOR ME ZERO..pissed me off that I spent a great deal of money on an item and THEY DID NOTHING. Stay away from this seller. I would give zero stars if I could
customer_reviews.author: The Wood's

customer_reviews.title: Went on easily using the gun and looks good
customer_reviews.text: Didn't think I could do this--approached the job with some trepidation. Went on easily using the gun and looks good. So far the results appear to be adhering well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Romanelli

customer_reviews.title: Great liner!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Great product, easy application, good coverage. Remember, the key to success on any spray on product is preparation
customer_reviews.author: Trent S. Aiken

customer_reviews.title: blow a load like a raptor
customer_reviews.text: Splat! The shutz gun worked great and I splattered up the rockers on my vw van. The material is indestructable and gets a nice textured finish. It is catalyzed so you have to use whatever you mix all at once. Have yore parts to be sprayed all ready and remember a little goes a long way.
customer_reviews.author: chrissyn

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Product was sent untinted when I requested black. Had to spend $50 on pigment at local paint shop to fix issue. I used on my truck still happy with product 2+ years later. Does chip on sharp edges/corners eventually. Would buy again if I don’t upgrade to Line-x.
customer_reviews.author: SinFire77

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It seemed to work pretty well. The fumes are very strong so make sure ypu wear a good facemask.
customer_reviews.author: matt

product_meta.title: U-Pol 0820V-Gun Black Urethane Truck Bed Liner Kit with 726 Gun
product_meta.description: This product is a 2-component urethane system designed for application directly to most original manufacturers' paint finishes or any self-etching primer surface. Dries rapidly and protects against rust, corrosion, UV damage, and extreme temperatures while resisting stains and abrasion. U-Pol Raptor makes an excellent sound deadener under or inside vehicles. Waterproof material stays flexible and reduces road noise and vibration. Cannot ship to Alaska.. Cannot ship to Alaska. WARNING: This product can expose you to chemicals which is [are] known to the State of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm. For more information go to www.P65Warnings.ca.gov.
feature_bullets: Bed liner helps deaden sounds and vibrations

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars446 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
